svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - February 5 2022
February 5 2022

title: "Week in Ethereum News
February 5, 2022" date: "2022-02-05"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
‚Ä¢ Latest core devs call video . Notes from Tim Beiko : Stakers should be cognizant to have enough disk space in case of non-finality
periods Kiln devnet expected late next week, app devs & infrastructure providers should test on this prior to public testnets Testnets in
our post-PoW world: Goerli & Sepolia to continue, Ropsten & Rinkeby to be deprecated Shanghai upgrade discussion on EIPs to include: EVM
changes, account abstraction, reduction in rollup fees & removing self destruct Preview of executable spec for execution layer
‚Ä¢ Stakers should be cognizant to have enough disk space in case of non-finality periods
‚Ä¢ Kiln devnet expected late next week, app devs & infrastructure providers should test on this prior to public testnets
‚Ä¢ Testnets in our post-PoW world: Goerli & Sepolia to continue, Ropsten & Rinkeby to be deprecated
‚Ä¢ Shanghai upgrade discussion on EIPs to include: EVM changes, account abstraction, reduction in rollup fees & removing self destruct
‚Ä¢ Preview of executable spec for execution layer
‚Ä¢ Vitalik‚Äôs proposal for blob transactions in same format as sharding to provide scaling relief for rollups, along with a simpler version
Proof of Stake consensus layer
‚Ä¢ Danny Ryan‚Äôs Finalized PoS update : engineering progressing for PoW switch off; no progress on client diversity, run a minority client
to protect your ETH
‚Ä¢ Lighthouse v2.1.2 : improves peer stability, Key Manager API support & optimized Docker images
‚Ä¢ Prysm v2.0.6 : patch release, improved memory usage, JSON API fixes
‚Ä¢ Lodestar v0.34.0 : optimization for non-finality periods, Bellatrix spec upgrades & fixes and remote signer support
‚Ä¢ Polynya: Danksharding explainer
‚Ä¢ Ben Edgington‚Äôs Upgrading Ethereum book Simple Serialize (SSZ) chapter
PoW switch off
‚Ä¢ Kiln v1 spec (pre-production sprint for PoW switch off): optimistic sync fixes, semantic changes to better handle reorgs
‚Ä¢ Geth close to being ready for PoW switch off, one major PR awaiting tests
EIPs/Standards
‚Ä¢ EIP4762 : Statelessness gas cost changes
‚Ä¢ EIP4760 : SELFDESTRUCT bomb
‚Ä¢ EIP4758 : Deactivate SELFDESTRUCT
‚Ä¢ EIP4750 : EOF Functions
‚Ä¢ EIP4747 : Simplify EIP 161
‚Ä¢ EIP4736 : Consensus Layer Withdrawal Protection
Layer2
‚Ä¢ L2Savings : shows Layer 2 transactions and estimated saving if these were made on mainnet
‚Ä¢ Sliding window for challenge process, allows significant decrease of the deadline for challenge-response and expands the deadline during
congestion
‚Ä¢ Secure Asymmetric Frugal Exchange prototype for optimized batched cross-chain swaps, gas efficient transferring from Layer 2 to mainnet
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Celer !
Celer Network is a layer-2 scaling platform that brings fast, secure and low-cost blockchain applications.
Check out our Inter-chain Message Framework , currently live on testnet !
Devs can now build inter-chain-native dApps with efficient liquidity utilization, coherent application logic, and shared states.
With Celer‚Äôs IM framework, devs can:
‚Ä¢ Bridge assets + make cross-chain calls at the same time
‚Ä¢ Pass arbitrary messages and execution instructions all with a single click
Check out our developer docs .
Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Foundry gas reports : gas usage report generated when running tests
‚Ä¢ Hardhat roadmap : opinionated, streamlined default experience, with ability to opt-out of defaults
‚Ä¢ Remix v0.21 : migrated to React, updated backup & restore, added StarkNet plugin, removed Optimism plugin as no longer required
‚Ä¢ EthereumJS: VM v5.7 : opcode dynamic gas costs for debugging and easier state manager customization Client v0.3 : added RPC endpoints
for logs, transaction receipt & transaction by hash and support for Sepolia testnet TX v3.5 : additional data integrity checks
‚Ä¢ VM v5.7 : opcode dynamic gas costs for debugging and easier state manager customization
‚Ä¢ Client v0.3 : added RPC endpoints for logs, transaction receipt & transaction by hash and support for Sepolia testnet
‚Ä¢ TX v3.5 : additional data integrity checks
‚Ä¢ Ethers.js v5.5.4 : support invalid IPFS URI format
‚Ä¢ ExcessivelySafeCall : Solidity library to call untrusted contracts and prevent return bombing by specifying maximum bytes to copy
‚Ä¢ Cloaks : ERC721 with bid commit/reveal scheme, mint price is mean of bids; SPADES variant: revealers get discounted mint, public mint
price increases per mint and decays per block
‚Ä¢ Cairo Language Server : adds Cairo support to IDEs implementing Language Server Protocol such as VS Code, early preview
‚Ä¢ Cairo Math 64x61 : fixed point 64.61 math library
‚Ä¢ Sign-In with Ethereum docs
‚Ä¢ Single use address guide, without the need for a private key (Nick‚Äôs method)
‚Ä¢ Alchemy NFT API on mainnet
‚Ä¢ 0x Protocol v4 NFT swaps , off-chain & on-chain listings, lowers gas costs, on Ropsten testnet
‚Ä¢ 3D interactive NFT using gITF (Graphics Language Transmission Format)
‚Ä¢ Tweet storm of building on-chain SVG NFT project
‚Ä¢ OpenSea‚Äôs guide to creating an NFT using Hardhat, IPFS & OpenZeppelin
‚Ä¢ Intro to web3 for web2 frontend devs
Security
‚Ä¢ Wormhole‚Äôs Solana/Ethereum bridge ~$300 million exploit , attacker spoofed guardian signatures after input wasn‚Äôt properly validated,
120k Wormhole ETH minted on Solana, 93k ETH bridged back to Ethereum
‚Ä¢ Qubit bridge post-mortem , code modified after audit, additional mitigations could have reduced risk
‚Ä¢ Index Coop Rari pool attempted attack , Uniswap V3 TWAP oracle manipulation prevented by arb bot, attacker lost 68 ETH
‚Ä¢ List of Smart Contract Vulnerabilities
Ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Vitalik‚Äôs reminder on shared security , rollups are just as secure as Ethereum mainnet, Validiums somewhat less secure,
sidechains/independent layer 1s much less secure
‚Ä¢ NFT marketplaces should show transfer recipient information such as ENS, account name, previous transfers and NFTs held to prevent
transfer errors
‚Ä¢ 0xPARC: ZK-Identity should be used to re-architect identity systems putting users in control of their data
‚Ä¢ Sign-in with Ethereum: concept of session keys , ephemeral keys for a user‚Äôs session, stored in the browser with very limited
permissions
Enterprise
‚Ä¢ GameStop NFT marketplace to be powered by Immutable X, marketed as carbon neutral with no gas fees; $100 million for creator grants
‚Ä¢ Nike sues StockX for selling NFTs with unauthorized images of sneakers
Application layer
‚Ä¢ UMA optimistic oracle live on Optimism, Boba Network & Arbitrum
‚Ä¢ Thales migrated to Optimism
‚Ä¢ Rubic multichain swaps adds Arbitrum
‚Ä¢ Mean Finance v2 Dollar Cost Average protocol for tokens live on Optimism
‚Ä¢ Kuiper permissionless index tracking live on mainnet
‚Ä¢ Utopia Core : DAO payroll, payments & expenses using Gnosis Safe, public beta
‚Ä¢ Lit Protocol adds token gated Zoom meetings/webinars and WordPress
‚Ä¢ Arcade NFT lending platform live on mainnet
‚Ä¢ Rarible adds floor bids for any NFT in a collection
‚Ä¢ Mirror Plugins : first plugin is minting ERC20 tokens
Job Listings
‚Ä¢ Re7 Capital ‚Äì a DeFi yield fund ‚Äì is hiring analysts and data engineers
‚Ä¢ Wanna build a cutting edge ETH Staking pipeline? üÖê‚Ñô‚ìÖüÑª ∏ for Ether Capital
‚Ä¢ Senior Technical Writer to take ownership & completely redo Geth docs
‚Ä¢ EF research hiring Networking Engineer
‚Ä¢ Internship program at Nethermind (1-3 month)
Reach developers experienced with Ethereum.¬† $600 for four issues (~75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth on
mainnet, Arbitrum or Optimism.¬† Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
‚Ä¢ India to tax transfer of digital asset income at 30%
‚Ä¢ UK tax authority guidance treats DeFi deposits as asset disposal triggering capital gains
‚Ä¢ US Virtual Currency Tax Fairness bill reintroduced to exempt personal crypto transactions where gains are $200 or less
‚Ä¢ Circle runs ads in US newspapers on how the US can win the digital currency space race
‚Ä¢ ConsenSys acquires MyCrypto to join MetaMask team
‚Ä¢ Skepticism of ve-tokenomics : reduced investor base, staking derivatives, short term incentives, bribery and prisoners‚Äô dilemma
‚Ä¢ Update on the Triple Halving thesis
‚Ä¢ Visualization of ETH and BTC percentage share of fees over time
General
‚Ä¢ Estimating bit security of pairing-friendly curves
‚Ä¢ EU data protection authorities find industry bodies consent system violates GDPR and all data collected must be deleted
‚Ä¢ German Court rules embedding Google Fonts violates GDPR
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week‚Äôs news in
real time.
Permalink for this week‚Äôs issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-february-5-2022
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
‚Ä¢ Feb 11 ‚Äì PoW switch off community call
‚Ä¢ Feb 17 ‚Äì Schelling Point (Denver)
‚Ä¢ Feb 18-20 ‚Äì ETHDenver
‚Ä¢ Feb 23 - Mar 11 ‚Äì Codeless Conduct no-code hackathon (virtual)
‚Ä¢ Mar 9-24 ‚Äì Gitcoin Grants Round 13
‚Ä¢ Mar 11-16 ‚Äì Ethereum Rio
‚Ä¢ Mar 15 ‚Äì Cryptocurrency Class starts (virtual)
‚Ä¢ Mar 17-18 ‚Äì ETH Austin summit
‚Ä¢ Mar 29-31 ‚Äì ETHDubai
‚Ä¢ Apr 7-9 ‚Äì ETH Portland hackathon
‚Ä¢ Apr 18-25 ‚Äì Devconnect (Amsterdam)
‚Ä¢ Apr 19-20 ‚Äì Layer Two Amsterdam
‚Ä¢ Apr 20-21 ‚Äì The Alliance (gaming) summit (Amsterdam)
‚Ä¢ Apr 21 ‚Äì ETHconomics (Amsterdam)
‚Ä¢ Apr 22-24 ‚Äì ETHAmsterdam
‚Ä¢ May 3-8 ‚Äì spaghettETH (Milan)
‚Ä¢ May 20 ‚Äì US Fed CBDC discussion paper feedback deadline
‚Ä¢ Jun 10-12 ‚Äì ETHPrague
‚Ä¢ Jun 20-23 ‚Äì NFT.NYC
‚Ä¢ Jun 24-26 ‚Äì ETHNewYork
‚Ä¢ Jul 8 ‚Äì ETH Seattle summit
‚Ä¢ Jul 19-21 ‚Äì EthCC 5 (Paris)
‚Ä¢ Aug 19-21 ‚Äì ETHMexicoCity
‚Ä¢ Aug 27-28 ‚Äì DeFi Security Summit (Stanford)
‚Ä¢ Aug 29-31 ‚Äì Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford)
‚Ä¢ Nov 4-6 ‚Äì ETHSanFrancisco
‚Ä¢ Dec 2-4 ‚Äì ETHTaipei
